channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A boat dumped o/s 1- 3 Hadley Road, 28th November
item.description:
A boat full of rubbish has been dumped o.s 1-3 Hadley Road and has been there for a week. It is on the road in the kerbside. Please can this be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hadley Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement, 28th November
item.description:
Several people have tripped and fallen when passing this area, I would suggest a complete fix before somebody breaks a bone The location is at the start of the pathway leading to Earl Rise,just outside the Emmaus car park

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glyndon Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contractors not abiding to contract in this area, 28th November
item.description:
Salisbury Road is getting like a dumping ground, do the council not realise that a dirty road attracts fly tipping. Why do the contractors no longer clean Salisbury Road & Crown Lane , neither has been cleaned for months. Absolutely disgusting, just telling contractors that it has a complaint DOES NOT MEAN IT IS FIXED, Bromley need to get a grip on this areas street cleaning , as we do pay council tax , for services we are not receiving. Crown Lane hasn't had a through clean for more than 12 weeks because,SGN was working and still there is rubbish in pavement gullies , and in the gutters .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on foreign plate, 28th November
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked in this bay on Pope Rd near the junction with Chatterton Rd since the Spring. It has not moved. The bay is ‘precious’ as it is a free to park bay and the space is not available to residents nor visitors to the shops and businesses in the area. Please tow it away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pope Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate signage indicating cycle and pedestrian paths, 28th November
item.description:
The section of the Dollis Valley Greenwalk between Western Way to Totteridge Lane begins as shared use and then splits into a cycle path and a pedestrian path through to Totteridge lane, there are signs at either end of each section indicating which is cycle and which is pedestrian, however these signs are small, aged and vandalised. There are no pathway markings once people have passed the signs. Frequently there are pedestrians on the cycle path, e.g. today, one lady pushing a pram glued to her phone, she would not have seen the signs but might have seen pathway markings. There are frequently dog walkers with unpredictable dogs. Recently I pings a couple from behind with my bell, having slowed down to almost a stop, and the male took issue with this, I reminded it was a cycle path and he denied it was and threatened to punch me and throw my bike into the brook. I suspect with proper signage people would realised sooner, or at least when they encounter a bike. This section of the green walk is on cycle route planners so cyclists do use it, and given there is provision for cycles steps should be taken to reduce conflict and the scope for harm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dollis Valley Greenwalk, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in flood water gulley Angel walk, 28th November
